I borrowed leaning heavily on @class from Microformats, and I've been using=
 @name (redundantly with @class) in my form elements (which lets the form a=
ctually work if you submit it).  @id doesn't seem like a good fit since you=
 could conceivably have more than one resource with the same relationship (=
for example, a collection of forms, differing only by the @action, that you=
 can submit to update a given resource).  @class could work technically, bu=
t isn't it usual/best practice to make your rels as URI's and it isn't it o=
dd to see a URI in a @class? I know it's allowed.
